review: It's great but kept dropping signal my chromecast did not have that problem
author: aaron haji

review: I have not really worked with it much.  Not real happy with it.  It will cost me more to use.
author: Robert E. Wilson

review: I connected my Fire Stick through an Onkyo NR838 receiver without any connectivity issues. Several reviewers had said that it would not connect through a receiver but it worked fine with my Onkyo. After watching the mandatory orientation video, it automatically registered the unit and came back with the home screen. Entered my Netflix info and began watching a movie all within about 10 minutes total start to finish. The Stick is about the same speed as my Roku 3 maybe a little faster but not a lot. Controlling the Stick through my Kindle Fire will take a little getting use to but it should not be a problem.
author: James Martin

review: Got the Fire TV Stick a couple weeks ago. Initially it was a little slow loading the latest software, but that is because in the location that I have it there is not the best WiFi signal. Every since the initial software update I have not had any problems streaming content or watching TV shows or movies. Love the Fire TV stick and might be buying some as stocking stuffers this year.
author: N Beck

review: Great Product - my kids love it.
author: Natural Kingdom
